attributes.action: Make recycling for all businesses compulsory and easily accessible
attributes.background: Cost-effective recycling is a particular problem for small businesses, which often cannot access residential recycling schemes run by councils and may not be big enough to gain attractive contracts for waste disposal from large providers. Landfill tax has risen to £84.40 but this isn't working.
attributes.additional_details:
The Government continually increasing the rate to encourage businesses to recycle more of their waste isn't enough.The Federation of Small Businesses (FSB) highlighted this issue, calling for free waste recycling for micro-businesses. The organisation is also calling for better access for all SMEs.

60% of waste that goes to landfill could have been recycled. If the Government want to increase consumption in our economy then they need to do something about it from an environmental point.

attributes.action: Stop DWP removing Motability cars before the Appeal Process is exhausted.
attributes.background: Motability car drivers are disadvantaged when PIP assessments mean they can no longer keep their cars.
attributes.additional_details:
Personal Independence Payment (PIP) assessment means disabled people are quite often assessed at the standard rate for mobility. This means they are no longer entitled to a Motability vehicle. The letter informing them of this gives them four weeks to return their cars. 

If their reconsideration and/or appeal is successful, they will have given up their cars for nothing. 

Please find a way to help these people keep their cars until a final appeal is unsuccessful.

attributes.action: Force Airlines to offer nut free meals as an option.
attributes.background:
People with nut allergies can die of anaphylactic shock if they ingest nuts. Whilst it is possible to order Kosher, Muslim, Vegetarian, reduced salt etc etc meals. Not one airline will offer nut free meals as an option. 

It should be a legal requirement to make a nut free option available.
attributes.additional_details:
Here is a list of the "Special Meal" options from British Airways:-

Type of meal

Lacto-ovo-vegetarian,
Vegan/vegetarian	
Asian/Hindu vegetarian
Muslim 
Kosher
Child meal	
Diabetic
Gluten intolerant	
Low calorie	
Low fat	
Low salt	
Low lactose

The above are meal choices. Yet someone who cannot eat nuts is not catered for. It is unreasonable for people on long haul flights particularly children to be denied safe food to eat.

attributes.action: Increase funding for the NHS!
attributes.background: Our NHS is in crisis at the moment! Some patients are waiting in corridors on trolleys for hours, waiting for treatment. Nothing is currently being done about it, yet it is risking numerous peoples lives. 1,000's of surgeries are being cancelled. PLEASE SIGN TO SAVE THE NHS AND INCREASE SPENDING!
attributes.additional_details: The NHS is an amazing service which allows free healthcare for all and saves millions of lives each year! Each year, especially during winter, there is a struggle for resources but this year it is a lot worse than usual and risking patients lives. Thousands of surgeries are being cancelled due to there being no beds available which could be causing a persons life expectancy to drop dramatically. PLEASE SIGN THIS TO SAVE OUR NHS!

attributes.action: Stop High street shops keeping their doors open regardless of the weather.
attributes.background:
Make retail outlets keep their doors routinely closed when premises are heated to reduce the energy (heat) which is currently wasted.
This will reduce the impact on the environment and global warming by reducing as well as significantly reducing operating costs for retailers.
attributes.additional_details:
You would not leave your door open in all weathers at home.
 Legislation exists to improve energy efficiency in new buildings but High street retailers routinely keep external doors open simply as a marketing tool. Automatic door openers offer some benefit but these are often disabled simply to encourage shoppers to enter and buy. Legislation applying to all retailers will provide a level playing field and reduce any perceived marketing benefit which drives the current bad practice.

attributes.action: Limit the amount private parking enforcement companies can charge.
attributes.background: Many carparks are monitored by private parking enforcement companies. It is logical to ensure people obey parking rules but they often apply massive fines of £100 for minor parking violations. For many people such high fines cause financial difficulties, this is too high  for minor infractions.
attributes.additional_details: It is of course right to ensure people use carparks fairly and obey the rules. However it is totally unfair that a charge of £100 can be applied for say an overstay of just a few minutes.  For sites where people pay to park I think the limit should be £50 or 5 times the amount of underpayment, whichever is the lower.

attributes.action: Make all injunctions free for those who are victims of domestic violence.
attributes.background:
My mum had been a victim of domestic violence for 20 years. A painful journey it had been. After finding the courage to leave she looked into implementing an injunction which was charged at £130 for each year. 
Victims are being left with an impossible choice save themselves or pay for the letter.
attributes.additional_details:
Injunction - An injunction is an equitable remedy in the form of a court order that compels a party to do or refrain from specific acts. A party that fails to comply with an injunction faces criminal or civil penalties, including possible monetary sanctions and even imprisonment. They can also be charged with contempt of court 

Wikipedia (2016) 'Injunction' available from https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Injunction

attributes.action: Ban or heavily tax makeup which has been tested on animals
attributes.background: I feel animals have a voice which we ignore, we should make a stand to help the animals in their innocence

attributes.action: Allow hospital A&E to refer people to minor injuries units if not an emergancy
attributes.background: Recently several minor injuries units in my local area were closed to staff A&E for patients that likely did not have life threatening injuries. Allow A&E departments to refuse treatment for non-emergency patients so they can focus more on saving the lives of those that need them.

attributes.action: Stricter regulations for complaints handling, for communications providers
attributes.background: Phone companies and other providers are neglecting their duties to provide effective customer service for complaints handling. Too many times we as consumers are lied to and made false promises, because these companies can.
attributes.additional_details: It's time the government responded and did something to protect consumers from unfair practice and make complaints handling legislation stricter.

attributes.action: Raise the minimum wage for Under 25's to £7.50 in line with all other workers.
attributes.background: Young people can be paid considerably less for work than an adult, in the same role at the same company; U18's can be paid as little as £4.05 per hour & U21 £5.60; This pay gap is discriminatory legislation, which says YP are worth less than older citizens (Regardless of ability to perform the job.)
attributes.additional_details:
It's near impossible to live a decent quality of life on earnings around the minimum wage; So why for under 25's who work in the same roles as adults can be paid £3.45p/h less an hour despite being potentially better educated more capable than their adult counterparts. Many under 25's work their jobs to help low-income parents provide necessities and I feel this discriminatory legislation therefore unfairly targets the young people of low-income backgrounds who are just about managing to cover the costs of running a household...

I therefore petition the government for pay equity for under 25's.

attributes.action: Force all councils to have an adequate quantity of lorry parks for lorries.
attributes.background: Lorry driving is a stressful . The best way of helping drivers deal with this is for them to get adequate rest. There are not enough spaces in the majority of service areas. Councils should be compelled to provide enough parking and adequate services to accommodate the amount of traffic.
attributes.additional_details: There are not enough lorry parks in the UK and the vast majority of them have woefully poor services such as showers and decent food vendors. The majority of them have fast food outlets which encourages unhealthy eating etc. Getting proper rest areas would make the roads safer and provide good business opportunities as almost all haulage firms are prepared to pay the fees.

attributes.action: Make car insurance more affordable for all persons who have never made a claim.
attributes.background: I never knew some years ago that my no claims bonus would expire after two years, as a result of this obtaining affordable car insurance is now near impossible! I have purchased a used car for £500 and my insurance quotes are well over £1000 with a deposit equivalent to my households weekly income!
attributes.additional_details: I think that all persons should have a "claims background record" that would be similar to credit history wear all past claims and no claims are noted. I have been driving for 15 years and have never made a claim in my life! How is it fair that I or anybody else should be penalised for not having any proof of no claims. I have had to take out temporary cover costing me £75 for 7 days until I figure out what I can do! If I took the insurance on offer simply paying the deposit would mean my children and myself would starve, no bills would get paid and we would also be without gas and electric, and that is the reality of the situation and it simply needs to change.

attributes.action: Remove the law that states you must stay in education until you are 18.
attributes.background: In England, you must stay in some form of education until you are 18 years old. I believe this is wrong, as it limits the choice of young people. If this law was removed, everyone would have the ability to do what they want to do after they leave school.
attributes.additional_details: As a college student myself, I understand how many people who are 16 or 17 years old feel. I believe at this age we lack rights. We don't have the right to vote, and we don't have the right to make a choice on our own futures. I feel for many, attending college isn't the right choice, and unless we are able to secure an Apprenticeship, there is no way for us to leave. Personally I find remaining at college difficult, as I would like to seek full time employment, but that choice isn't available.

attributes.action: Make all school 'inset days' during 'half term' periods, to save childcare cost.
attributes.background: Schools in the UK typically have 6 holiday periods per year. During this time, many parents need to pay for additional childcare or take time off work. In addition to this, schools also take many add hoc inset days (teacher training days). This training should be done during half term periods.
attributes.additional_details:
Schools doing their training during the half term periods, would save millions of parents time, money and inconvenience. It's extremely difficult for full time working parents to accommodate those ad hoc days, when the school is closed to pupils. 

The school building should be utilised during the half term periods for teacher training, as this is not only convenient for parents, but would be a better use of the school facilities, many of which are paid for with public tax money.

attributes.action: Make living wage the same for everyone.
attributes.background:
The living wage should be the same for everyone, no matter the age, gender, race or anything else!

With bill prices rising and many younger individuals having their own houses & cars it's impossible to keep out of debt. 

If your doing the same job, role & hours you should get the same wage

attributes.action: Cyclists should complete a road safety test and pay for insurance and road tax.
attributes.background: Over the last few years there has been a increase in road accidents involving cyclists. Some accidents happen through a complete lack of road sense. It is dangerous to the cyclists and especially to drivers on the road. Cyclists should also pay for road tax and be insured if they are using the road.

attributes.action: Reduce Vat on Post from outside the UK.
attributes.background: It is quite absurd that an item costing £19.00 ($22.00 US) should then incur a £14 odd vat and handling charge. The handling charge of £8 is placed by the Royal Mail regardless of size weight or cost of item, and is added for anything with VAT to be paid.
attributes.additional_details: Some of the Vat Charges on small items are hardly worth the cost of auditing and tracking the payments, it would probably be more cost effective to have a slightly higher cut off, this will also have the effect of reducing the resentment the British public have in paying the extraordinary large charge to the Royal Mail for low cost items.

attributes.action: Government stop using JAM to describe those on the  breadline and apologise
attributes.background: This group of people struggle to make ends meet they use food banks and often go without. This terminology is a deliberate attempt to disguise this as a sweet little group, rather than those forced to use food banks or go hungry. It is wordplay at it's most disgusting stop and apologise.

attributes.action: Ban all-metal manhole covers on roads
attributes.background: Having ridden motorcycles for a number or years, I have had many encounters with slippery manhole covers on roads, especially while cornering.  The change in surface grip leads to the wheels of the vehicle slipping, potentially causing serious consequences.
attributes.additional_details: There are two practical solutions; either replace the manhole covers with a non-metallic material or coating existing covers with a higher grip material.

attributes.action: Change the law and policy on the use of fireworks in the UK.
attributes.background: Following a recent petition calling for a ban and the official response, to further obtain public opinion on the misuse of fireworks. Government to fund research into the impact on human and animal health and well being to be the primary aim of the research.

attributes.action: Make Gift Aid easier for donors and recipients with a single, simple mechanism
attributes.background: The mechanism to provide Gift Aid to a charity is too complex, takes too much effort and fails too often.  It is almost like the Government does not want to provide Gift Aid. Everyone would benefit is this were simpler, and more successful with a single, easy, standard mechanism.
attributes.additional_details:
Often people are put off donating because of Gift Aid complexities, Gift Aid fails or people get overburdened by different Gift Aid cards etc. Charities waste money dealing with complex Gift Aid processes.

Ideally, there would be a single, simple mechanism to provide Gift Aid. This could be a single card type mechanism provided by Charities (recognised by Government and Charities). Alternatively, a unique identifier (eg a ‘Gift Aid’ number or possibly the NI number) would be sufficient.

attributes.action: Add the option for 'None of the Above' on Local / General Election Ballot Papers
attributes.background: Voting is being effected by the lack of a direct, quantifiable outlet for frustrated people to express themselves.It causes negative voting and confused issues. People should have a way to say candidates/campaigns tactics are not good enough;if say 25% reached a rerun with new candidates triggered.
attributes.additional_details: Voting should be a positive experience. i.e FOR someone or something. Too often, the choice is often about the 'least worst option'. The ballot paper needs to give a credible alternative.The electorate needs a way to encourage postive campaigning and ultimately reject a set of bad candidates.I believe by giving everyone the option of quanitfiably registering their frustration with candidates/campaigns we can force politicians away from devisive language and personal attacks & increase turn out.

attributes.action: Simplify the legal process of buying and selling a home
attributes.background: Buying and selling a home in the U.K. is an overly complicated, slow, and frustrating process. Introduce a single body to deal with 'searches' (Land Registry?), create an online system to track progress and facilitate communication, and reduce the ability of parties to make changes prior to exchange
attributes.additional_details: The current system has barely changed in decades. Solicitors still communicate via post, creating huge delays waiting for various documents to be passed between parties. Too many separate entities need to be consulted, often to confirm obvious or know facts. The existing system provides no incentive to reform the process as it generates significant 'easy money' for solicitors, estate agents and others, with buyers and sellers lacking the knowledge to challenge the process.

attributes.action: HM Forces exempt Higher rate Stamp Duty on additional residential properties
attributes.background: The MOD have changed service personnels pensions, pay and allowances persistently for the worst over the last decade. To supplement their heavily reduced pensions on retirement service personnel in the past have built up property portfolios, the Government have now made this practically impossible
attributes.additional_details: In the Autumn Statement on 25 November 2015, the Chancellor of the Exchequer announced that higher rates of Stamp Duty Land Tax would apply from 1 April 2016 to purchases of additional residential properties, such as second homes and buy-to-let properties. With the Armed Forces numbers shrinking on a daily basis and recruitment drives failing this would be a big incentive for serving personnel to provide a return of service for exemption from Higher rates of Stamp Duty Land Tax (SDLT).

attributes.action: Debate why restaurants have so few allergy free options and why more isn't done
attributes.background: In many restaurants there's often only one or two gluten free options on a menu when could be more. For instance if chips were fried GF, as they would otherwise be GF. Instead often the same oil used for frying breadcrumb/batter based food to save money. There are other instances of this as well.
attributes.additional_details: It's reported 7% of U.K. population have a gluten allergy or intolerance, this affecting a few million people. There are a few restaurants that do make the effort and why not many more. For instance some restaurants use separate oil but many don't. This would very easily widen the choice when eating out with family and friends making it a much more enjoyable experience, which otherwise can be quite off-putting. This should also be debated on other allergies and what could be done to help.

attributes.action: Make the laws protecting chickens apply to all birds including game birds
attributes.background: The suffering of game birds being bred in tiny wire cages for shooting estates on the One Show BBC1 31 October 2016 is sickening. Birds were breaking their necks bashing their heads against the wire roofs of their tiny cages whilst trying to escape. They are then wrongly sold as free range.

attributes.action: To allow our Daughter in Law from China to come to UK to meet us
attributes.background:
Our son has been married for four and half years and had to sell up here in the uk to be with his wife as she had two applications turned down once because they did not believe they were married second that she would not return to China.
We are now in our late 80s and would like to meet her soon

attributes.action: Establish protocols for all new born babies with law bound practises.
attributes.background: Our youngest daughter was born with hyperextension in her right knee. The midwife refused to touch her and had no knowledge or experience of this condition. The physio didn't have experience, the health visitors ignored us when milestones were missed. How many other children were not being supported
attributes.additional_details:
After lots of nagging and persuasion we got the referrals we needed. At almost two she was finally getting the level of care she needed. The new physio told us that children as old as four were unable to walk- this lead us to question what happened to them?
The physio gave us the idea of the protocol. There are key documents supporting children with special educational needs and disabilities but they are no good without knowledge and guidelines for less well known conditions. MAKE PROTOCOLS LAW

attributes.action: Stop the UK selling arms to any side of the Syrian conflict
attributes.background: The only way of ending the conflict in Syria is to stop supplying sides with arms. The UK government has a responsibility to ensure that any involvement in conflicts do not harm the citizens of that country or make the situation worse. Arming any side in Syria is prolonging the conflict.
attributes.additional_details: It is time to do what we can to help Syrian citizens and stop our involvement.

attributes.action: Enshrine the UKRI's long-term mission and Haldane principle in Royal Charter
attributes.background: The Higher Education and Research Bill 2016 will dissolve UK Research Councils' Royal Charters and form a super-council, UK Research & Innovation (UKRI), to act strategically across disciplines. The UKRI must aim to fund research for the UK's long-term good, at arm's length from day-to-day politics.
attributes.additional_details: Higher Education and Research Bill 2016 [Bill No 004 of 2016-17]

attributes.action: Allow intended parents of surrogate children, to have legal right from birth,
attributes.background: When surrogates are used they have the legal right to keep that child even if they have no biological connection, I want intended parents to have legal right of the child from birth to give more people a chance to have a child without fear of it the surrogate keeping them.

attributes.action:
Debate WAVE POWER v Fracking & Nuclear -  all 3 are Constant 
Sources of power.
attributes.background:
Other "constants" Fracking and Nuclear are dangerous and dearer, tax
gets lost, profits go overseas, amnesia over decommissioning & waste.

attributes.action: Rebuild concorde as a bomber for RAF
attributes.background: We have no heavy bombers just jets and would be cheap as all ready have Airframe and Concorde is a great plane and supersonic .We can develope it to handle all bombs  .Great Britain needs to help the RAF get their heavy bomber
attributes.additional_details: Type RAF planes active duty your see no heavy bombers .We can not fight a large ground war without heavy bombers on our own if Europe falls

attributes.action: Reduce the drink drive limit in England and Wales to the same level as Scotland
attributes.background: In 2014 an estimated 240 people were killed in Great Britain in accidents where at least one driver was over the legal limit. Drinking and driving increases the risk of a crash and the likelihood that death or serious injury will occur. Reducing the limit will save lives and make our roads safer.
attributes.additional_details: In December 2014 the Scottish Executive introduced The Road Traffic Act 1988 (Prescribed Limit) (Scotland) Regulations 2014 which reduced the legal alcohol limit for drivers to 50 milligrams of alcohol in every 100 millilitres of blood. The limit in England and Wales is 80 milligrams of alcohol per 100 millilitres of blood. Bringing the limit in England and Wales in line with the limit in Scotland would be very beneficial as it would reduce accidents, preventing serious injury and death.

attributes.action: Increase British military support in protecting endangered animals in Africa.
attributes.background: Hundreds of thousands of endangered animals in Africa are being poached every year throughout the continent. Many of the countries where this poaching is most common are very limited on resources that is needed to protect these animals. The British military would have the resources to make a impact.

attributes.action: Bring back a discounted fee for regular users of the dartford crossing! DART-TAG
attributes.background: The discounted price of £1.67 is not good enough! As an everyday user I now pay roughly £1219.10 a year in crossings, living 10 mins away in erith! Whereas a few roads away in dartford people have the option to pay a £20 yearly fee! This is appalling - there's needs to be support for everyday users.
attributes.additional_details:
The previous dat tag gave the option of discounted prices, not only for local residents but commuters and regular users.

There is no support for those crossing everyday, they are instead paying out Thousands a year, when those locally have the option of a £20 annual fee.

The payments should have been scrapped once the cost of building was settled.

The Dartford Crossing is raking in £3MILLION per week in fines alone as people can not afford this upkeep on top of their cost of living!

attributes.action: Scrap HS2, and build the best internet system in the world instead.
attributes.background: HS2 makes no difference to the vast majority and solves old world issues. The disruption over a long period make the cost uncertain, with little benefit to the vast majority of the public and industry. Let's build the very best internet instead and make the UK the worlds leading tech nation instead!
attributes.additional_details:
Fixing overcrowded railways will turn out way same as fixing overcrowded motorways, the more you build the more crowded they become. With driverless cars around the corner, let's jump a stage ahead and move commercial traffic to the railway system and focus on making commercial communication better with the best internet the world has seen so far.
We and the next wave of innovators would all benefit from the side effect of hyper fast and super efficient internet in ways not even thought of yet.

attributes.action: Monday November 12 2018  be a UK  National Public Holiday to mark the end of WW1
attributes.background: During the past four years the Gov and the UK have been commemorating many events associated with the First World War - now as we near the 100th anniversary of its end , make the Monday nearest to Remembrance Day a National Holiday for people to reflect on the conflict that had just eneded

attributes.action: To make it more financially beneficial to work than it is to claim benefits!
attributes.background:
Being on benefits is easy! I believe it should be  made hard, and the more you work, the better rewarded you are! 

As a single parent, I want to work, have a better life and be a good role model. But the more I work, the less I have! It's so wrong!

attributes.action: Make it illegal for landlords todiscriminate against families with children.
attributes.background: Landlords should not be able to refuse to rent their propert to people based on whether they have children or not unless there is a safety issue. Many do not refuse on this basis and even stipulate criteria like 'one child only.' This practice should not be allowed to continue.

attributes.action: Stop the sale of kittens and puppies in pet shops
attributes.background: It is devastating to see that there are so many stray dogs and cats on the streets these days. Many are due to the fact that people go to pet stores, see an adorable little baby kitten or puppy and buy it on whim then further on down the line become bored and they end up in shelters up for adoption.
attributes.additional_details:
We can prevent this drastically if pet shops stop selling puppies and kittens. It will force people to go to the shelter and adopt an animal from there or make them think about it instead of buying them on impulse. Some pet shops won't vet the home it is going to, to make sure it's going to the best home possible.
We ask for urgent action to raise awareness & encourage the public to choose a responsibly bred puppy/kitten with history information, or adopt from a legitimate rescue organisation.

attributes.action: Investigate the standard of care provided by local CFS ME services in the uk.
attributes.background: Chronic fatigue syndrome (CFS) / myalgic encephalomyelitis (ME), is a debilitating disease that causes many symptoms including severe fatigue. The quality of care appears to be perticually poor in the uk, especially in rural counties, with some services acting outside of nice guidelines.
attributes.additional_details: My personal experience with my local CFS service has been extremely poor, I was 16 when diagnosed and until I was 18 I was seen 3 times be a children's OT. All that my local CFS service offers is an initial information session (the information was mostly wrong), an initial assessment and a 6 week managing life styles group, this is completely contradictory to the NICE guideline. And they do not offer CBT or GET, 2 of the 3 treatments recommended by NICE. This is not the only service like this!

attributes.action: Permanently move Parliament to a more UK population central location.
attributes.background: The seat of power in the UK has for too long resided in a place inaccessible to most of the country. This has resulted in generations of regional underinvestment and the revenue creation capacity of our country massively skewed to financial services in the City, Greater London and the South East
attributes.additional_details: With a new parliament location a more commutable distance, we can also do away with the cost of many second homes for MPs. The £40+Billion cost of HS2 can be reallocated to pay for a new Parliament building (The final cost of Holyrood was put at £414M) and the renewal of the rail infrastructure to support it. After hundreds of years of revenue flowing from the rest of the UK to the South East, it’s about time it started seeding sustainable growth elsewhere.

attributes.action: England, Wales and Northern Ireland to hold a referendum on Scotland leaving UK
attributes.background: For the past 300 years England has been held responsible for all the failures that has beset Scotland. A referendum was held and the people of Scotland decided to remain in the UK. I believe the concessions given to the people was unreasonable and very expensive for the rest of the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
I believe it has now become unfair that the rest of the UK is continually being asked to fit the bill in Scotland. 
It must be remembered that Scotland has free University education, free nursing home care for the elderly.
I do accept these are it would be good for all the UK to have these however, others accept these are affordable because of the subsidies Scotland receives. The latest request for half a billion pounds is the latest demand.

attributes.action: Provide statistical report of areas / numbers of culled badgers hosting TB.
attributes.background: The Government failed to test culled badgers to measure the percentage hosting tuberculosis & the most affected areas.  This data is key. UK Government ignored advice of Wildlife Experts by continuing the Badger cull. Other wildlife such as Deer host TB, so the badger cull policy is flawed.
attributes.additional_details: Despite all efforts by wildlife experts to stop the badger cull the Government continues with a badly devised scheme to reduce TB.  The most important data was never obtained. Recording the number of affected culled badgers and the areas where TB was most prevalent is surely crucial for developing a strategy to reduce Bovine TB.  A statistical report will show where number of TB hosts are more severe.  Joined up interventions such as vaccinations and bio-security on farms are needed.

attributes.action: Create an Autumn Bank Holiday in November
attributes.background: The gap between the Late Summer Bank Holiday and Christmas Day is almost four months. An Autumn Bank Holiday would provide a welcome break between the two. Perhaps it could be based around Armistice Day, November 11.

attributes.action: Criminalise the act of impersonating serving military personnel or veterans
attributes.background:
It is getting common recently for civilians to impersonate military service men/women by claiming they are serving or are veterans.

This causes great distress to many veterans and families and is a blatant disregard.

The Stolen Valor Act 2005 has to a great degree mitigated this in the USA.

attributes.action: Start an domestic abuse register
attributes.background: This will enable you to find out if your new partner has ever been charged or suspected of domestic abuse offences and enable you to check court records for non molestation orders issued against them. Domestic abuse is growing and this register would empower the individual to protect themselves

attributes.action: Allow alternative advanced chemotherapy treatment in the UK
attributes.background: We have a very close friend who is terminally ill with cancer. Our dear friend Brigitta, who is a mother of 2 children, Marco and Denym and loving wife to Massi has fought this dreadful disease for 13 years and endured various forms of treatment. She is now in need of advanced specialist treatment
attributes.additional_details:
To enable Brigitta to live her life and feel slightly more normal again, we are having to raise £30,000 to send her overseas for specialist medical treatment which could really make a difference to her health and current situation. 
If this was to be available in the UK to Brigitta, then her family would not have the concerns they do about funds and could have this advanced treatment without having to rely so much on other peoples help. 
We are currently organising events and fundraising pages to help Brigitta through her journey, and hope we reach this goal to get her this treatment that she deserves.
Please help and support this worthy cause, and get this treatment into the UK!
